TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Runtime extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides information about the MonoTouch Runtime.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.Arch Arch;
.field public static valuetype MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.Arch Arch

Docs.summary: The architecture where the code is currently running.
Docs.remarks: Use this to determine the architecture on which the program is currently running (device or simulator).

MemberSignature.Value: public static void ConnectMethod (System.Reflection.MethodInfo method, MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.Selector selector);
.method public static hidebysig void ConnectMethod(class System.Reflection.MethodInfo method, class MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.Selector selector) cil managed

Docs.param: Method to register with the runtime.
Selector that will we want to connect to.
Docs.summary: This call allows the specified method in this method to respond to message invocations on this selector.

remarks.para: The method must be declared on an NSObject-derived class.
You can use this method to dynamically reconfigure which methods on a class should respond to which Objective-C selectors.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Delegate GetDelegateForBlock (IntPtr methodPtr, Type type);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Delegate GetDelegateForBlock(native int methodPtr, class System.Type type) cil managed

Docs.param: Objective-C block native object.
Type of a delegate matching the signature for the specified Objective-C block.
Docs.summary: This method supports the Xamarin.iOS runtime and is not intended for use by application developers.
Docs.returns: Returns a delegate of the given type that can be used to invoke the Objective-C block in the provided handle.

MemberSignature.Value: public static T GetINativeObject<T> (IntPtr ptr, bool owns) where T : class, MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.INativeObject;
.method public static hidebysig !!T GetINativeObject<class (class MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.INativeObject) T>(native int ptr, bool owns) cil managed

Docs.typeparam: INativeObject type that will wrap the specified native object.
Docs.param: A pointer to an unmanaged object.
Pass true if the caller has a reference to the native object, and wants to give it to the managed wrapper instance. Otherwise pass false (and the native object will be retained).
Docs.summary: Wraps an unmanaged IntPtr into a wrapped INativeObject.
Docs.returns: An instance of a class implementing the T interface.

remarks.para: Returns an instance of the T interface even if the native object is not in the class hierarchy of T (no type checks).

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject GetNSObject (IntPtr ptr);
.method public static hidebysig class MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject GetNSObject(native int ptr) cil managed

Docs.param: A pointer to an unmanaged NSObject or any class that derives from the Objective-C NSObject class.
Docs.summary: Wraps an unmanaged IntPtr into a fully typed NSObject, or returns an existing wrapper object if one already exists.
Docs.returns: An instance of a class that derives from MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject.
Docs.remarks: The runtime create an instance of the most derived class.

MemberSignature.Value: public static T GetNSObject<T> (IntPtr ptr) where T : MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject;
.method public static hidebysig !!T GetNSObject<(class MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject) T>(native int ptr) cil managed

Docs.typeparam: Type to wrap the native object as.
Docs.param: A pointer to an unmanaged NSObject or any class that derives from the Objective-C NSObject class.
Docs.summary: Wraps an unmanaged IntPtr into a fully typed NSObject, or returns an existing wrapper object if one already exists.
Docs.returns: An instance of the T class.

remarks.para: Returns an instance of the T class even if the native object is not in the class hierarchy of T (no type checks).
This method will fail if there already is a managed wrapper of a different (and incompatible) type for the native object.

MemberSignature.Value: public static T GetNSObject<T> (IntPtr ptr, bool owns) where T : MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject;
.method public static hidebysig !!T GetNSObject<(class MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject) T>(native int ptr, bool owns) cil managed

Docs.param: A pointer to an unmanaged NSObject or any class that derives from the Objective-C NSObject class.
Pass true if the caller has a reference to the native object, and wants to give it to the managed wrapper instance. Otherwise pass false (and the native object will be retained).
Docs.summary: Wraps an unmanaged IntPtr into a fully typed NSObject, or returns an existing wrapper object if one already exists.
Docs.returns: An instance of the T class.

remarks.para: Returns an instance of the T class even if the native object is not in the class hierarchy of T (no type checks).
This method will fail if there already is a managed wrapper of a different (and incompatible) type for the native object.

MemberSignature.Value: public static IntPtr GetProtocol (string protocol);
.method public static hidebysig native int GetProtocol(string protocol) cil managed

Docs.param: Name of the Objective-C protocol.
Docs.summary: Returns the handle of the Objective-C protocol descriptor for the given protocol name.
Docs.returns: The protocol handle for the given protocol name.
Docs.remarks: This is the equivalent of the objc_getProtocol function call.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Generic.List<WeakReference> GetSurfacedObjects ();
.method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Generic.List`1<class System.WeakReference> GetSurfacedObjects() cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves a list of all the Objective-C objects that have been surfaced to the managed world.

remarks.para: The list contains weak references, to allow GC to take place.
This method is only for diagnostic purposes, and should not be relied upon.

MemberSignature.Value: public static event MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.MarshalManagedExceptionHandler MarshalManagedException;
.event class MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.MarshalManagedExceptionHandler MarshalManagedException

Docs.summary: This event is raised when a managed exception needs to be marshalled to native code.

MemberSignature.Value: public static event MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.MarshalObjectiveCExceptionHandler MarshalObjectiveCException;
.event class MonoTouch.ObjCRuntime.MarshalObjectiveCExceptionHandler MarshalObjectiveCException

Docs.summary: This event is raised when an Objective-C exception needs to be marshalled to managed code.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void RegisterAssembly (System.Reflection.Assembly a);
.method public static hidebysig void RegisterAssembly(class System.Reflection.Assembly a) cil managed

Docs.param: The assembly to process.
Docs.summary: Registers all of the classes in the specified assembly.
Docs.remarks: This iterates over all the types that derive from NSObject in the specified assembly and registers them with the runtime.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void StartWWAN (Uri uri);
.method public static hidebysig void StartWWAN(class System.Uri uri) cil managed

Docs.param: Uri to probe to start the WWAN connection.
Docs.summary: This method forces the WAN network access to be woken up.
Docs.remarks: When the phone is not on WiFi, this will force the networking stack to start.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void StartWWAN (Uri uri, Action<Exception> callback);
.method public static hidebysig void StartWWAN(class System.Uri uri, class System.Action`1<class System.Exception> callback) cil managed

Docs.param: Uri to probe to start the WWAN connection.

Callback that will be called when the WWAN connection has been started up. This callback will be invoked on the main thread. If there was an exception while trying to start the WWAN, it will be passed to the callback, otherwise null is passed.
Docs.summary: This method forces the WAN network access to be woken up asynchronously.
Docs.remarks: When the phone is not on WiFi, this will force the networking stack to start.

MemberSignature.Value: public static MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject TryGetNSObject (IntPtr ptr);
.method public static hidebysig class MonoTouch.Foundation.NSObject TryGetNSObject(native int ptr) cil managed

Docs.param: A pointer to an unmanaged NSObject or any class that derives from the Objective-C NSObject class.
Docs.summary: Looks up an existing wrapper object for an unmanaged IntPtr.
Docs.returns: If a managed wrapper exists for the specified IntPtr, that wrapper is returned, otherwise null.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool UseAutoreleasePoolInThreadPool { get; set; }
.property bool UseAutoreleasePoolInThreadPool

Docs.summary: A value that specifies whether the Mono runtime should automatically create an NSAutoreleasePool for every work items on the threadpool.
Docs.remarks: This is enabled by default, but since creating an NSAutoreleasePool adds overhead for every work item, it's possible to disable it for apps that find this overhead unacceptable.
